_direction.description: ltr (the default) if the language is left-to-right, rtl if right-to-left

_language_code.description: Language code used by HTML, e.g. 'en'

another client took control.description: Displayed if another web client takes the connection

At start of threading.description: Displayed if you try to undo threading past the beginning

At start of weaving.description: Displayed if you try to undo weaving past the beginning

Back to front.description: Setting to thread from the back of the loom to the front

cannot jump.description: Part of an error messsage: cannot perform the requested jump

Clear Recents.description: Pattern menu item to clear recent entries

Command mock loom.description: Heading for the debug controls that are only shown in mock mode

connected.description: Shown when the loom server is fully connected to the loom

connecting.description: Shown when the loom server is in the process of connecting to the loom

Debug (mock loom).description: Heading for debug controls when using the mock loom

Direction control.description: Label text for a setting that allows the user to specify how weave/unweave direction is controlled

disconnected.description: Shown when the loom server is fully disconnected from the loom

disconnecting.description: Shown when the loom server in the process of disconnecting from the loom

Front to back.description: Setting to thread from the front of the loom to the back

Group size.description: Number of warp ends to raise shafts for when threading

Jump.description: Label for the button that applies the requested jump

Left to right.description: Setting: thread from left to right

Loom name.description: Name of the loom to display in the web interface

Loom.description: Direction control: Loom (typically a button on the dobby head)

lost connection to server.description: Error message if the connection from the user to the loom server drops

Next.description: Button label for debug control that tells the mock loom to request the next shed

Number must be.description: Example: user-specified numeric value must be <= 0

no pattern.description: Displayed if no weaving pattern has been selected

On the left.description: Setting: display warp thread 1 on the left

On the right.description: Setting: display warp thread 1 on the right

Read message.description: Label for debug display of the most recent message read from the loom

Reset.description: Label to clear the Jump input

Right to left.description: Setting: thread from right to left

Save.description: Button that submits a new loom name

Sent command.description: Label for debug display of the most recent command sent to the loom server

Shafts.description: Label for display of which shafts are raised

Separate repeats?.description: Should there be a separator row, with all shafts down, after each pattern repeat?

Settings.description: Tab heading for the Settings panel

Thread.description: Threading direction: go forward to thread new heddles. Also a label for menus that control the users's preferences for threading, e.g. front to back or back to front

Threading.description: Tab heading for the Threading panel

timed out.description: Part of an error message if a command times out

Too many files.description: Displayed if a user tries to upload too many files at once

Unthread.description: Threading direction: go backwards to undo a mistake

Unweave.description: Weaving direction: go backwards to undo a mistake

Upload.description: Button label to upload weaving pattern files

Warp thread 1.description: Setting: display warp thread 1 on the right or left

Warp threads.description: Label for current warp thread numbers (in Threading mode)

Weave.description: Weaving direction: go forward to weave new cloth

Weaving.description: Tab heading for the weaving panel

Weft thread.description: Label for the current weft thread number (in Weaving mode)

?.description: Question mark representing an unknown value
